      • useDebugMode

        public void useDebugMode()

      • calulateEuclideanGivenScale

        public TransformationParameters calulateEuclideanGivenScale(double scale,
                                                   PairIntArray matchedXY1,
                                                   float[] weights1,
                                                   PairIntArray matchedXY2,
                                                   float[] weights2,
                                                   double centroidX1,
                                                   double centroidY1)
        coordinate transformations from image 1 to image 2 are calculated from matching lists of x, y coordinates, and given "scale" as a starting parameter. Scale is determined roughly from the contour matcher, so can be used to get a rough first solution. positive Y is up positive X is right positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW 270 | | 180--------- 0 +X | | 90 -Y
        Parameters:
        scale -
        matchedXY1 -
        weights1 -
        matchedXY2 -
        weights2 -
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        Returns:

      • applyTransformation

        public double[] applyTransformation(TransformationParameters params,
                           int centroidX1,
                           int centroidY1,
                           double x1,
                           double y1)
        from a set of transformation parameters params that transform points in reference frame 1 into reference frame 2, transform the point (x1, y1) into reference frame 2.
        Parameters:
        params -
        centroidX1 - x centroid of reference frame 1
        centroidY1 - y centroid of reference frame 1
        x1 - the x coordinate of point (x1, y1) to transform
        y1 - the y coordinate of point (x1, y1) to transform
        Returns:
        the coordinates of (x1, y1) transformed into reference frame 2

      • swapReferenceFrames

        TransformationParameters swapReferenceFrames(TransformationParameters params,
                                           int centroidX2,
                                           int centroidY2,
                                           double x1,
                                           double y1,
                                           double x2,
                                           double y2)
        from a set of transformation parameters params that transform points in reference frame 1 into reference frame 2, create a transformation that can transform points in reference frame 2 into reference frame 1. (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) are the same point in both frames and are used to calculate the translation.
        Parameters:
        params - transformation parameters to apply to points in reference frame 1 to put them in reference frame 2
        centroidX2 - the x centroid of reference frame 2
        centroidY2 - the y centroid of reference frame 2
        x1 - x coordinate of point (x1, y1) in reference frame 1
        y1 - y coordinate of point (x1, y1) in reference frame 1
        x2 - x coordinate of point (x2, y2) in reference frame 2, where (x2, y2) is the (x1, y1) transformed to reference frame 2
        y2 - y coordinate of point (x2, y2) in reference frame 2, where (x2, y2) is the (x1, y1) transformed to reference frame 2
        Returns:
        transformation parameters that can transform points in reference frame 2 into reference frame 1
